intro: Quebitea guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese quebitea, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, flat seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
